Detailed Description

Set representing multiple transport media to be used with APOXI OBEX.

This class is mainly used for two purposes:

  • Implementing Transport Address Selection, which is carried out by the OBEX application. After having received an ObexAppMsg, the OBEX application will need to set up a dialog for choosing transports similar to the following example:

      void  MySelectionDialog::FillTransports()
      {
         ObexTransportSet           set  = ObexMngr::GetInstance().EnumTransports();
         ObexTransportSet::Iterator iter = set.Begin();

         // Iterate over transports contained in the set
         for ( ; iter.IsValid(); ++iter ) {
            // Add entry to selection dialog
            AddTransport( iter->GetObjectId(), iter->GetMmiName() );
         }
      }

  • Specifying an exclusion set to restrict an ObexServer to bind to some transports when using wildcard addressing ( Open("*://", ...) ).

See also:
ObexMngr

ObexServerDispatcher

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ObexTransportSet::ObexTransportSet (   )  [inline]
 

Default constructor. Constructs an empty set.

Transports can be added at a later time by calling the Add() method on it.

Member Function Documentation

UINT8 ObexTransportSet::GetCount (   )  const
 

Returns the number of transports contained in the set.

void ObexTransportSet::Include (  const String &  scheme  ) 
 

Adds a transport to the set.

Example:

            ObexTransportSet    set;

            //  Build a transport set containing the IrDA and Bluetooth transports.
            set.Include("irdaobex");
            set.Include("btgoep");

Parameters:
scheme String containing the protocol identifier or so-called 'URL scheme' of the transport to be added to the set.

void ObexTransportSet::Include (  const ObexAbstractTransport &  xp  ) 
 

Adds a transport to the set.

Parameters:
xp Reference to the transport to be added to the set.
